tweets.text: RT @Acyn: McNamee:I stand with Ben Collins and every other journalist who is trying to do their job in the face of this unrelenting assault…
@colinmegill Naw I'd use OBS instead

@colinmegill OBS lets you decide what you send to Twitch to be streamed, and lets you set scenes to switch between, you probably only need one scene that captures your entire screen + microphone audio. Download here: https://t.co/TdpcIlGgAr
@colinmegill yes, the live tweeting is fun but only works about 50% as effectively as streaming for me - def try Twitch, if you need any help setting up OBS let me know
@colinmegill I have found a nice hack to do a task I don't necessarily want to do is to livestream it- bonus is that sometimes people will come into the chat and help

@maartenzam understanding which notebooks will result in leads is an entirely different art- I prefer to just make many things I am interested in, and then when someone wants me to make more of something I am like "hell yeah" because I was already doing / interested in it
@maartenzam Variations have been working for me for the last decade (with a brief corporate pit stop) - this specific model is undergoing testing but showing promising results
@mikusthetiger This looks really interesting, definitely going to give it a read- thanks for the rec!

hey guys here's the model, you can have it for free- if you do really good dataviz on a subject area, write up your analysis as an observable notebook (really good SEO there) - from then on, people who google that subject area find your work, and then hire you to do it
@georgejoseph94 @WNYC @Gothamist @THECITYNY @BrianLehrer Wow! Congrats! They are very lucky to have you!
